intro: Karwinskia pubescens, commonly known as the desert holly, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It is adapted to full sun and well-drained soils, making it drought-tolerant. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for xeriscaping in desert landscapes.
